issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: HiveServer2 is leaking ClassLoaders when add jar / temporary functions are used due to constructor caching in Hadoop ReflectionUtils

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I can repo this on branch-1.2 and branch-2.0.

It looks to be the same issues as: HIVE-11408

The patch from HIVE-11408 looks to fix the issue as well.

I've updated the patch from HIVE-11408 to be aligned with branch-1.2 and master
fields.summary: HiveServer2 is leaking ClassLoaders when add jar / temporary functions are used

comments.body: [~tleftwich] Can you elaborate a bit more? Looks like branch-1.2 and branch-2.0 don't use Hadoop's reflection utils (replaced by Hive's reflection utils here: HIVE-10329). The patch for HIVE-11408 was targeted at pre 1.2 releases on branch-1.

It looks to be that when calling CREATE TEMPORARY FUNCTION via JDBC through Hiveserver2, The Function is still being created through the registerGenericUD*F methods:
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/branch-1.2/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/Registry.java#L141

Which still uses the org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils class.

[~tleftwich] Thanks for the pointer. Indeed, there is still a dependence on org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils. I think a better idea would be to use https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/branch-1.2/common/src/java/org/apache/hive/common/util/ReflectionUtil.java and remove hadoop's ReflectionUtils. What do you think?
Ok, sounds like a better option, I'll go get that working and update the patch. Thanks
[~tleftwich] Thanks a lot for looking into this.

Ok, The patch i've provided will work for branch-1.2 and branch-2.0, Thought I'm not sure the best way to write a test for this. 

I have tested it manually, I opened a beeline session ran ADD JAR and CREATE TEMPORARY FUNCTION and then closed the session,.Ran this 100+ times while looking at jmap -histo:live dump to see if the ClassLoaders weren't leaking and it looks good.

[~tleftwich] Thanks for the updated patch. The patch itself looks good, but for unit testing, I was wondering if there could be a way to count classloaders before / after the add jar + create temporary query. As an example, over here: https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/26b5c7b56a4f28ce3eabc0207566cce46b29b558/common/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/common/JavaUtils.java#L81 we walk the classloader hierarchy.

Apologies for the delay. 
Added a new patch that will count the size of the constructor cache entries before and after an add jar.

Only for branch-1 but will add a patch for master.
[~tleftwich] Thanks for the patch. Look forward to the one for master. I'll review this one shortly.
I've added a new patch for master.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12801679/HIVE-13561.3.patch
